panels.description: Cloud storage read throughput from ch.cern.CloudFSMetrics

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative("value", 1s)  FROM "ch.cern.CloudFSMetrics.bytesRead" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY process

panels.title: Cloud Storage bytes read/sec

panels.description: Cloud storage write throughput from ch.cern.CloudFSMetrics

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative("value", 1s)  FROM "ch.cern.CloudFSMetrics.bytesWritten" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY process

panels.title: Cloud Storage bytes written/sec

panels.description: Cloud storage read operations from ch.cern.CloudFSMetrics

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative("value", 1s)  FROM "ch.cern.CloudFSMetrics.readOps" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY process

panels.title: Cloud Storage read ops/sec

panels.description: Cloud storage read operations from ch.cern.CloudFSMetrics

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative("value", 1s)  FROM "ch.cern.CloudFSMetrics.writeOps" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY process

panels.title: Cloud Storage write ops/sec
Spark Plugins: CGroup Metrics (use with Spark on K8S)

panels.description: Total executor CPU utilization computed from executors'  container cgroup instrumentation. The value is normalized in "N# of core equivalent", that is the number of cores running at 100% that would give an equivalent value of CPU utilization.

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative("value", 1s)  / 1000000000 FROM "ch.cern.CgroupMetrics.CPUTimeNanosec" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY process

panels.title: Executors Container CPU Utilization (N# cores-equivalent)

panels.description: Network bytes in, throughput from ch.cern.CgroupMetrics.NetworkBytesIn

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative("value", 1s)  FROM "ch.cern.CgroupMetrics.NetworkBytesIn" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY process

panels.title: Network bytes in/sec

panels.description: Network bytes in, throughput from ch.cern.CgroupMetrics.NetworkBytesOut

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative("value", 1s)  FROM "ch.cern.CgroupMetrics.NetworkBytesOut" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY process

panels.title: Network bytes out/sec

panels.description: Memory RSS from ch.cern.CgroupMetrics.MemoryRss

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative("value", 1s)  FROM "ch.cern.CgroupMetrics.MemoryRss" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY process

panels.title: Memory RSS

panels.description: Memory RSS from ch.cern.CgroupMetrics.MemorySwap

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative("value", 1s)  FROM "ch.cern.CgroupMetrics.MemorySwap" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY process

panels.title: Memory Swap

panels.description: Memory RSS from ch.cern.CgroupMetrics.MemoryCache

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative("value", 1s)  FROM "ch.cern.CgroupMetrics.MemoryCache" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY process

panels.title: Memory Cache

panels.description: HDFS read throughput from ch.cern.HDFSMetrics

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative("value", 1s)  FROM "ch.cern.HDFSMetrics.bytesRead" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY process

panels.title: HDFS bytes read/sec

panels.description: HDFS write throughput from ch.cern.HDFSMetrics.bytesWritten

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative("value", 1s)  FROM "ch.cern.HDFSMetrics.bytesWritten" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY process

panels.title: HDFS bytes written/sec

panels.description: HDFS read ops from ch.cern.HDFSMetrics.readOps

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative("value", 1s)  FROM "ch.cern.HDFSMetrics.readOps" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY process

panels.title: HDFS read ops/sec

panels.description: HDFS large read ops from ch.cern.HDFSMetrics.largeReadOps

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative("value", 1s)  FROM "ch.cern.HDFSMetrics.largeReadOps" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY process

panels.title: HDFS large read ops/sec

panels.description: HDFS read throughput from ch.cern.HDFSMetrics.bytesLocalHost

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative("value", 1s)  FROM "ch.cern.HDFSMetrics.bytesReadLocalHost" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY process

panels.title: HDFS bytes read localhost (bytes/sec)

panels.description: HDFS read throughput from ch.cern.HDFSMetrics.bytesReadDistanceOfFiveOrLarger

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative("value", 1s)  FROM "ch.cern.HDFSMetrics.bytesReadDistanceOfFiveOrLarger" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY process

panels.title: HDFS bytes read distance 5 or larger (bytes/sec)

panels.description: HDFS read throughput from ch.cern.HDFSMetrics.bytesReadDistanceOfOneOrTwo

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative("value", 1s)  FROM "ch.cern.HDFSMetrics.bytesReadDistanceOfOneOrTwo" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY process

panels.title: HDFS bytes read distance 1 or 2 (bytes/sec)

panels.description: HDFS read throughput from ch.cern.HDFSMetrics.bytesReadDistanceOfThreeOrFour

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative("value", 1s)  FROM "ch.cern.HDFSMetrics.bytesReadDistanceOfThreeOrFour" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY process

panels.title: HDFS bytes read distance 3 or 4 (bytes/sec)

panels.description: Latest sample of the value of number of active tasks, summed over all executors active in the selected time filter interval.

targets.query: select sum(perprocessval) from (SELECT process, last("value") as perprocessval FROM "threadpool.activeTasks" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' and $timeFilter GROUP BY process)

panels.title: N# of Active Tasks - latest value

panels.description: Total executor CPU time computed from from executor metrics. Displays CPU time used by all the executors' JVMs active in the selected time filter interval. It contains CPU time used for executing tasks and for other activities in the JVM, notably garbage collection. Note, values from executors that are no more active in the selected time window are not accounted for.

targets.query: select sum(lastvalperprocess) from ( SELECT process, last(value) as lastvalperprocess FROM jvmCpuTime WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' and $timeFilter GROUP BY process)

panels.title: Total Executors CPU time

panels.description: Total task CPU usage from task metrics. Displays CPU time used for all the completed tasks, from the task metrics data source. Note, values from executors that are no more active in the selected time window are not counted.

targets.query: select sum(lastvalperprocess) from (SELECT process, last(value) as lastvalperprocess FROM "cpuTime.count" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' and $timeFilter GROUP BY process)

panels.title: Total Task CPU Usage

panels.description: Total time spent in GC operations during task execution. Displays values for all the completed tasks, from the task metrics data source. Note, values from executors that are no more active in the selected time window are not counted.

targets.query: select sum(perprocessval) from (SELECT process, last("value") as perprocessval FROM "jvmGCTime.count" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' and $timeFilter GROUP BY process)

panels.title: Total Task GC Time

panels.description: Failed tasks for the appStatus metrics. Conditional to spark.metrics.appStatusSource.enabled=true (default is false)

targets.query: SELECT "value" FROM "tasks.failedTasks.count" WHERE ("applicationid" =~ /^$ApplicationId$/) AND $timeFilter

panels.title: N# of Failed Tasks

panels.description: Number of running stages from the DAG scheduler.

targets.query: SELECT "value" FROM "stage.runningStages" WHERE ("applicationid" =~ /^$ApplicationId$/) AND $timeFilter

panels.title: Current N# of Running Stages - latest value

panels.description: Latest value of the % of heap memory used, averaging over executors and driver. JVM metric from MemoryMXBean. Conditional to spark.metrics.conf.*.source.jvm.class=org.apache.spark.metrics.source.JvmSource

targets.query: select mean(lastvalperprocess)*100 from  (SELECT process, last(value) as lastvalperprocess FROM "heap.usage" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' and $timeFilter GROUP BY process)

panels.title: Heap memory Used (% of maximum usable)

panels.description: Bytes read from HDFS. Note, values from executors that are no more active in the selected time window are not counted.

targets.query: select sum(lastvalperprocess) from (SELECT process, last(value) as lastvalperprocess  FROM "filesystem.hdfs.read_bytes" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' and $timeFilter GROUP BY process)

panels.title: Cumulative HDFS Bytes Read

panels.description: Bytes written to HDFS. Note, values from executors that are no more active in the selected time window are not counted.

targets.query: select sum(lastvalperprocess) from (SELECT process, last(value) as lastvalperprocess  FROM "filesystem.hdfs.write_bytes" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' and $timeFilter GROUP BY process)

panels.title: Cumulative HDFS Bytes Written

panels.description: Number of completed tasks, from JVM threadpool metrics. Note, values from executors that are no more active in the selected time window are not counted.

targets.query: select sum(perprocessval) from (SELECT process, last("value") as perprocessval FROM "threadpool.completeTasks" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' and $timeFilter GROUP BY process)

panels.title: N# of Completed Tasks

panels.description:
Number of failed stages from the appStatus 
 metrics.
Conditional to a configuration parameter:
spark.metrics.appStatusSource.enabled=true (default is false)

targets.query: SELECT "value" FROM "stages.failedStages.count" WHERE ("applicationid" =~ /^$ApplicationId$/) AND $timeFilter

panels.title: Failed Stages

panels.description: Number of succeeded jobs, from the appStatus metric (introduced in Spark 3.0). Conditional to spark.metrics.appStatusSource.enabled=true (default is false)

targets.query: SELECT value FROM "jobs.succeededJobs.count" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' and $timeFilter

panels.title: Succeeded Jobs Count

panels.description: Number of active tasks per executor.

targets.query: SELECT value FROM "threadpool.activeTasks" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY process

panels.title: Number of Active Tasks

panels.description: Total executor CPU utilization computed from executors' JVM instrumentation. The value is normalized in "N# of core equivalent", that is the number of cores running at 100% that would give an equivalent value of CPU utilization.

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative("value", 1s)  / 1000000000 FROM "jvmCpuTime" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY process

panels.title: Executors JVM CPU Utilization (N# cores-equivalent)

panels.description: Time the JVM process has spent in garbage collection. The value is normalized in "N# of core equivalent", that is the hypothetical number of cores working at 100% on GC that would give an equivalent result.

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative("value", 1s)  / 1000 FROM  "jvmGCTime.count" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY process

panels.title: Garbage Collection Time (N# of cores equivalent) - from task metrics

panels.description: Total task CPU utilization computed from task metrics. The value is normalized in "N# of core equivalent", that is the number of cores running at 100% that would give an equivalent value of CPU utilization.

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative("value", 1s)  / 1000000000 FROM "cpuTime.count" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY process

panels.title: Task CPU Utilization (N# cores equivalent) -  from Task metrics

panels.description: Executor run time and wait time components compared. The run time spent by Spark executors is aggregated per area of activity. The difference between tun time measuremets and wait time measuremts can be interpreted as due to time not instrumented (e.g. HDFS/filesystem I/O wait time). The values are normalized in "N# of core equivalent", that is the number of cores running at 100% that would yield an equivalent value for the given metric.

targets.query: select sum(perprocessval) from (SELECT non_negative_derivative(last("value"), 1s) / 1000000000 as perprocessval FROM "deserializeCpuTime.count" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), process) GROUP BY time($__interval)

select sum(perprocessval) from (SELECT non_negative_derivative(last("value"), 1s) / 1000 as perprocessval FROM "deserializeTime.count" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), process) GROUP BY time($__interval)

select sum(perprocessval) from (SELECT non_negative_derivative(last("value"), 1s) / 1000000000 as perprocessval FROM "cpuTime.count" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), process) GROUP BY time($__interval)

select sum(perprocessval) from (SELECT non_negative_derivative(last("value"), 1s) / 1000000000 as perprocessval FROM "shuffleWriteTime.count" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), process) GROUP BY time($__interval)

select sum(perprocessval) from (SELECT non_negative_derivative(last("value"), 1s) / 1000 as perprocessval FROM "resultSerializationTime.count" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), process) GROUP BY time($__interval)

select sum(perprocessval) from (SELECT non_negative_derivative(last("value"), 1s) / 1000 as perprocessval FROM "shuffleFetchWaitTime.count" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), process) GROUP BY time($__interval)

select sum(perprocessval) from (SELECT non_negative_derivative(last("value"), 1s) / 1000 as perprocessval FROM "jvmGCTime.count" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), process) GROUP BY time($__interval)

select sum(perprocessval) from (SELECT non_negative_derivative(last("value"), 1s) / 1000 as perprocessval FROM "runTime.count" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), process) GROUP BY time($__interval)

panels.title: Executor run time and wait time components

panels.description: Executor run time and wait time components compared. The run time spent by Spark executors is aggregated per area of activity. The difference between tun time measuremets and wait time measuremts can be interpreted as due to time not instrumented (e.g. HDFS/filesystem I/O wait time). The values are normalized in "N# of core equivalent", that is the number of cores running at 100% that would yield an equivalent value for the given metric.

targets.query: select sum(perprocessval) from (SELECT non_negative_derivative(last("value"), 1s) / 1000000000 as perprocessval FROM "deserializeCpuTime.count" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), process) GROUP BY time($__interval)

select sum(perprocessval) from (SELECT non_negative_derivative(last("value"), 1s) / 1000 as perprocessval FROM "deserializeTime.count" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), process) GROUP BY time($__interval)

select sum(perprocessval) from (SELECT non_negative_derivative(last("value"), 1s) / 1000000000 as perprocessval FROM "cpuTime.count" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), process) GROUP BY time($__interval)

select sum(perprocessval) from (SELECT non_negative_derivative(last("value"), 1s) / 1000000000 as perprocessval FROM "shuffleWriteTime.count" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), process) GROUP BY time($__interval)

select sum(perprocessval) from (SELECT non_negative_derivative(last("value"), 1s) / 1000 as perprocessval FROM "resultSerializationTime.count" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), process) GROUP BY time($__interval)

select sum(perprocessval) from (SELECT non_negative_derivative(last("value"), 1s) / 1000 as perprocessval FROM "shuffleFetchWaitTime.count" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), process) GROUP BY time($__interval)

select sum(perprocessval) from (SELECT non_negative_derivative(last("value"), 1s) / 1000 as perprocessval FROM "jvmGCTime.count" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), process) GROUP BY time($__interval)

select sum(perprocessval) from (SELECT non_negative_derivative(last("value"), 1s) / 1000 as perprocessval FROM "runTime.count" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), process) GROUP BY time($__interval)

select sum(perprocessval) from (SELECT non_negative_derivative(last("value"), 1s) / 1000000000 as perprocessval FROM "PandasUDFRunAndReadTime" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), process) GROUP BY time($__interval)

panels.title: Executor run time and wait time components + Experimental Pandas UDF time metrics for SPARK-30306

targets.query: SELECT last("value") FROM "threadpool.completeTasks" WHERE ("applicationid" =~ /^$ApplicationId$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "process"

panels.title: Number of completed tasks per executor.

panels.description: Time the Executor has spent running tasks, including idle time and wait time (for I/O or other event). The value is normalized in "N# of core equivalent", that is the hypothetical number of cores working at 100% running tasks that would give an equivalent result.

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative("value", 1s) / 1000  FROM "runTime.count" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY process

panels.title: Run Time - from task metrics

panels.description: Storage memory and disk used by the block manager.

targets.query: SELECT value FROM "memory.onHeapMemUsed_MB" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY process
SELECT value FROM "memory.offHeapMemUsed_MB" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY process
SELECT value FROM "disk.diskSpaceUsed_MB" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY process

panels.title: Block Manager: memory and disk used

yaxes.label: Block manager memory and disk used

panels.description: Time the Executor has spent writing shuffle data. The value is normalized in "N# of core equivalent", that is the hypothetical number of cores working at 100% on shuffle writing that would give an equivalent result.

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative("value", 1s) / 1000000000  FROM "shuffleWriteTime.count" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY process

panels.title: Shuffle Write Time - from task metrics

panels.description: JVM Heap Memory

targets.query: SELECT value FROM "JVMHeapMemory" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY process

targets.query: SELECT value FROM "OnHeapStorageMemory" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY process

panels.description: MinorGCTime

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative("value", 1s)  / 1000 FROM  "MinorGCTime" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY process

panels.title: MinorGCTime

panels.description: MajorGCTime

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative("value", 1s)  / 1000 FROM  "MajorGCTime" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY process

panels.description: ProcessTreeJVMRSSMemory. Conditional to spark.executor.processTreeMetrics.enabled=true

targets.query: SELECT value FROM "ProcessTreeJVMRSSMemory" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY process

panels.title: ProcessTreeJVMRSSMemory

panels.description: ProcessTreePythonRSSMemory. Conditional to spark.executor.processTreeMetrics.enabled=true

targets.query: SELECT value FROM "ProcessTreePythonRSSMemory" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY process

panels.title: ProcessTreePythonRSSMemory

panels.description: Total memory (heap + non-heap) used per executor.  From MemoryMXBean.

targets.query: SELECT value FROM "total.used" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter AND process != 'driver'  GROUP BY process

panels.title: Executor JVM Total Memory Used

panels.description: Heap memory used per executor.  From MemoryMXBean.

targets.query: SELECT value FROM "heap.used" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter AND process != 'driver' GROUP BY process

panels.title: Executor JVM Heap Memory Used

panels.description: Total memory (heap + non-heap) used by the driver.  From MemoryMXBean.

targets.query: SELECT value FROM "total.used" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter AND process = 'driver' GROUP BY process

panels.title: Driver JVM Total Memory Used

panels.description: HDFS read throughput.

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative("value", 1s)  FROM "filesystem.hdfs.read_bytes" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY process

panels.title: HDFS bytes read/sec

panels.description: HDFS write throughput.

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative("value", 1s)  FROM "filesystem.hdfs.write_bytes" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY process

panels.title: HDFS bytes written/sec

panels.description: Shuffle read throughput.

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative("value", 1s)  FROM "shuffleTotalBytesRead.count" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY process

panels.title: Shuffle Total Bytes Read/sec - from task metrics

panels.description: Shuffle write throughput.

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative("value", 1s)  FROM "shuffleBytesWritten.count" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY process

panels.title: Shuffle Bytes Written/sec - from taskmetrics

panels.description: Details of shuffle I/O operations, local and remote.

targets.query: select sum(perprocessval) from (SELECT non_negative_derivative(last("value"), 1s) as perprocessval FROM "shuffleRemoteBytesRead.count" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), process) GROUP BY time($__interval)

select sum(perprocessval) from (SELECT non_negative_derivative(last("value"), 1s) as perprocessval FROM "shuffleLocalBytesRead.count" WHERE "applicationid" = '$ApplicationId' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval),  "process") GROUP BY time($__interval)

panels.title: Shuffle Read Composition

list.label: Spark Application Id
list.name: ApplicationId
list.query: SHOW TAG VALUES WITH KEY = "applicationid" WHERE "username" =~ /$UserName/
